decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission. Reason: As required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

A splay of 2.4m x 2.4m shall be provided on each side of the access, the depth measured from the back of the footway and the widths outwards from the edges of the access, and no fence, wall or other obstruction to visibility exceeding 0.6m in height above the surface of the adjoining highway shall be erected within the areas of such splays.Reason: In the interests of road safety in accordance with Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Council's Core Strategy.

The applicant is advised that the Council will require the applicant to undertake a road and footway condition survey before construction begins. This will take the form of a joint inspection with a member of the Highways Operation Team and will involve a photographic record and visual observation of the roads, verges and margins. The same team will secure a deposit to ensure that repairing cost is covered should any damage result from the construction associated with this site

The applicant is informed that the submitted details, as set out above are agreed and that Condition 12 (Secure Cycle Parking) of planning permission 20/03014/PAO2R is hereby discharged subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the details hereby approved.

Please also check these against the 3D drawings (Plan 08 and 09).If you are making alterations to the shopfront then this will need to be included in the application.Please review the plans to ensure they correlate, amend and resubmit where necessary.
